content: I am currently working on a regular expression in which I need to match a 15 digit number. The method I am using currently is "\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d\d". Is there a cleaner or more efficient way to represent this in my regex?

Yes, there is a more concise way to represent a 15-digit number using regular expressions. You can use the quantifier `{15}` to specify that you want exactly 15 digits. Here's how you can write it:

```regex
\d{15}
```

This pattern matches exactly 15 consecutive digits. It is cleaner and more efficient than repeating `\d` fifteen times.
